newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Forint ends weaker vs dlr, record BCE futures trade.
newsitem.headline: Forint ends weaker vs dlr, record BCE futures trade.

text.p: The Hungarian unit closed weaker against the dollar on Tuesday after lively trade, especially in the morning, dealers said.
The Hungarian unit ended at 160.15/20, compared to an opening of 159.80/90
"Activity by one bank early on brought the forint within 20 pips of the resistance level but buying turned to selling later on," said Jozsef Bodor of West LB Hungaria.
Most of the forint's losses were sustained in the morning as the dollar continued its overnight surge against the mark, dealers said.
The currency section of the Budapest Commodity Exchange saw record turnover of 16.71 billion forints, with the Ecu and the dollar accounting for the lion's share of trade.
Traders said trends on the international spot market had been mirrored in currency futures. The dollar either rose or remained steady while the Ecu and mark fell for most contracts.
